source.author: Barker, W.R.
source.title: Scrophulariaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Barker, W.R. (1999). Scrophulariaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Corolla yellow, sometimes with an orange palate; perennial
Corolla violet or purple, sometimes with a white or yellow palate; annuals
Corolla 2–2.7 mm long along upper side, spur at right-angles to tube, 1.5–2 mm long
Corolla 5–23 mm long along the upper side, spur backwards-directed from tube, 6.5–11 mm long
Plant completely glabrous; palate white or lilac; seeds with an encircling wing of papillae
Inflorescence and sterile stems pubescent; palate yellow or orange; seeds without an encircling wing
